alert.note: Alert for Jefferson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 10 at 1:29PM EST until March 14 at 5:30PM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR A POTENTIAL DAM BREAK NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding may occur from the potential failure of the Silver Crystal Dam. * WHERE...A portion of NORTH CENTRAL Kentucky, including a very small portion of the following county, Jefferson. * WHEN...Until 400 PM EDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding possible along Wilson Creek, mainly for portions of South Park Road. Secondary flooding concerns will be for Farmers Lane, and Hornback Lane. Railroad tracks along Wilson Creek will also possibly flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 129 PM EST, Jefferson County Emergency Management in coordination with the Kentucky Division of Water reported that dam failure could occur on the Silver Crystal Dam. If the dam does begin to fail, then a Flash Flood Warning will be issued. - Areas downstream of the dam along Wilson Creek, including South Park Road, Farmers Lane, and Hornback Lane are the most likely areas that could experience flooding if the dam fails. Railroad tracks running parallel to South Park Road may possibly flood. Use caution if in the area and be prepared to act quickly should the dam fail. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... areas just east of Fairdale and Minor Lane Heights. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Stay away or be swept away. Flooding across roadways can carry vehicles away.
